value.title: #2 DAX Fridays! 101: Introduction to filter and row context
value.excerpt: Are you new to DAX and want to learn what those things called filter context and row context are? I will attempt to do just that in today's video. value.title: Month over Month Calculation in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: When working with dates, one of the common types of analysis is period vs period, such as Year over year, and Month over month. value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?

value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870
